value.name: Junior doctors' strike: Some hospitals request staff return to work
value.description: NHS bosses have made more than 20 requests for striking junior doctors in England to be allowed to cross the picket line to help out services. None of the requests made on the first strike day have been granted so far by the British Medical Association (BMA).

value.name: Robert F Kennedy Jr qualifies for first presidential ballot in Utah
value.description: Independent candidate and anti-vaccination activist Robert F Kennedy Jr has qualified for the 2024 presidential ballot in his first state. Elections officials in Utah said Mr Kennedy Jr had collected the 1,000 signatures necessary for ballot access. He still faces a long battle to qualify in the other 49 US states and the District of Columbia.

video.name: Robert F Kennedy Jr qualifies for first presidential ballot in Utah

value.description: Mr Farage is currently Reform UK's president and the insurgent party is plotting how best to use the architect of Brexit.

value.name: Edinburgh's pavement parking ban enforced this month announces council
value.description: Edinburgh will become the first city in Scotland to enforce a ban on pavement parking, starting on January 29. Local authorities were given new powers to stop vehicles from parking on pavements by the Transport (Scotland) Act 2019, which came into effect in December.

value.name: Mortgage rates are falling but borrowers are still feeling the squeeze – a finance expert explains how to cut your repayments
value.description: Homeowners looking to remortgage and first-time buyers struggled to manage interest rate hikes in 2023. Here’s what to think about this year.

value.name: Reform UK rules out deal with the Tories as Nigel Farage ducks bid to become MP
value.description: Reform UK has “categorically” ruled out a deal with the Tories at the 2024 general election as Nigel Farage appears to have ducked an eighth bid to become an MP. In a move that piles yet more pressure on Rishi Sunak, Reform leader Richard Tice vowed to field candidates in every constituency in England, Wales and Scotland.

video.name: Richard Tice ‘confident’ Nigel Farage will play role in Reform UK

value.name: Israel-Hamas War: How The Violent Conflict Is Already Reaching Across The Middle East
value.description: The Israel -Hamas war has spilled out into the wider Middle Eastern region recently, with at least three areas now where violent skirmishes could escalate.

value.name: Wales looks to hold a major Esports tournament
value.description: Wales is aiming to position itself as a major player in the global Esports industry, most notably by integrating the focus within schools and colleges across the country.

value.name: Trump 2.0 is major security risk to UK, warn top former British-US diplomats
value.description: The Government urgently needs to prepare secret contingency plans to protect the UK if Donald Trump is elected as US President in November, three of Britain’s most experienced diplomatic figures have warned.

value.name: Watchdog to scrutinise Sunak’s claim the asylum backlog has been ‘cleared’
value.description: Rishi Sunak’s claim that ministers have “cleared” the asylum backlog is being investigated by the official statistics watchdog after allegations from opponents that it is a “barefaced lie”.

value.name: Landlords – Who gets your vote?
value.description: Hi, Do landlords have a viable political home? It appears not. Historically the Conservative party has been the party of the landlord, permitting the market to control itself to a large extent.

value.name: Reform rules out Tory pact as Sunak faces pressure to call election
value.description: Richard Tice, the leader of the Nigel Farage-linked party, claimed the Tories are ‘terrified’ of the threat Reform poses.

video.name: Reform UK rules out electoral pacts with Tories

value.name: Ed Davey launches “Tory Removal Service” poster as he calls for May 2024 election
value.description: Liberal Democrat Leader Ed Davey has unveiled a new ‘Tory Removal Service’ campaign poster, as he announces a new plan to force a May 2024 election and stop Rishi Sunak clinging on to power.

value.name: Live facial recognition cameras to be trialled in Harrogate and Scarborough pledges mayoral candidate
value.description: Cutting-edge live facial recognition cameras could be deployed in North Yorkshire as early as this year under Tory mayoral candidate Keane Duncan’s “tough-on-crime” agenda.

value.description: Reform UK to target Labour voters and claim Keir Starmer’s party will ‘bankrupt’ Britain if it wins next general election

value.name: New procedure for type 2 diabetics being assessed by NHS spending watchdog
value.description: The safety of a procedure for type 2 diabetes patients that uses heat to destroy the lining of part of the small intestine – allowing it to regrow so cells respond better to insulin – is being explored for potential NHS use by the spending watchdog.

value.name: Fishermen net benefits of leaving Common Fisheries Policy
value.description: Fishermen continue to net the benefits of being out of the Common Fisheries Policy after seeing yearly sales incomes rise.

value.name: UK general election: Three potential dates when Britain could go to the polls
value.description: Britain is on its third Prime Minister since Boris Johnson oversaw a landslide victory for the Conservatives in December 2019. In just four years the party has been hit by a number of scandals and now languishes around 20 points behind Labour in opinion polls.

video.name: Nicholas Cecil Reveals When Next General Election Is Likely To Be Held

value.name: Anti-Northern Ireland Protocol campaigner Ben Habib to fight Wellingborough by-election for Reform UK
value.description: NI Protocol campaigner Ben Habib will contest a Westminster byelection as a Reform UK candidate for Wellingborough.

value.name: Oxford professor warns against oversharing with AI chatbots
value.description: A professor of computer science at Oxford University has urged individuals using chatbot technology to avoid oversharing personal information.

value.name: Nigel Farage still 'assessing' what role he will play in general election, says Reform UK leader Richard Tice
value.description: Richard Tice says he has been in discussions with Mr Farage about a potential comeback, calling the former Reform UK leader a "master of political timing".

value.name: PSNI Investigate Serious Assault In Strabane
value.description: 03 January 2024 Road Users Urged To Stay Safe On NI's Roads In 2024 Road users have been urged to safeguard their safety and others using NI's roads in 2024. The release of provisional figures today by the PSNI show that 69 people died in road tragedies during 2023.

value.name: Nigel Farage ‘assessing’ his political comeback to party, says Reform UK leader

value.name: Are Covid Lockdowns Behind the Rise in Extreme Poverty in the Global South?
value.description: In the context of a huge increase in global poverty since 2020 which has driven political convulsions most especially in low-income countries, a closer look at pandemic policies is vital to safeguard against future missteps.

value.name: Reforms Needed To Prevent Future Political Collapse
value.description: 03 January 2024 New Parents Can Now Apply For Child Benefit Online HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) has announced that new parents can now claim Child Benefit online for the first time since it was launched 47 years ago, helping millions of families with the cost of raising their children.

value.name: Edinburgh's pavement parking ban enforced this month announces council
value.description: Edinburgh will become the first city in Scotland to enforce a ban on pavement parking, starting on January 29. Local authorities were given new powers to stop vehicles from parking on pavements by the Transport (Scotland) Act 2019, which came into effect in December.

value.name: Mortgage rates are falling but borrowers are still feeling the squeeze – a finance expert explains how to cut your repayments
value.description: Homeowners looking to remortgage and first-time buyers struggled to manage interest rate hikes in 2023. Here’s what to think about this year.

value.name: Reform UK rules out deal with the Tories as Nigel Farage ducks bid to become MP
value.description: Reform UK has “categorically” ruled out a deal with the Tories at the 2024 general election as Nigel Farage appears to have ducked an eighth bid to become an MP. In a move that piles yet more pressure on Rishi Sunak, Reform leader Richard Tice vowed to field candidates in every constituency in England, Wales and Scotland.

video.name: Richard Tice ‘confident’ Nigel Farage will play role in Reform UK

value.name: Israel-Hamas War: How The Violent Conflict Is Already Reaching Across The Middle East
value.description: The Israel -Hamas war has spilled out into the wider Middle Eastern region recently, with at least three areas now where violent skirmishes could escalate.

value.name: Wales looks to hold a major Esports tournament
value.description: Wales is aiming to position itself as a major player in the global Esports industry, most notably by integrating the focus within schools and colleges across the country.

value.name: Trump 2.0 is major security risk to UK, warn top former British-US diplomats
value.description: The Government urgently needs to prepare secret contingency plans to protect the UK if Donald Trump is elected as US President in November, three of Britain’s most experienced diplomatic figures have warned.

value.name: Watchdog to scrutinise Sunak’s claim the asylum backlog has been ‘cleared’
value.description: Rishi Sunak’s claim that ministers have “cleared” the asylum backlog is being investigated by the official statistics watchdog after allegations from opponents that it is a “barefaced lie”.

value.name: Landlords – Who gets your vote?
value.description: Hi, Do landlords have a viable political home? It appears not. Historically the Conservative party has been the party of the landlord, permitting the market to control itself to a large extent.

value.name: Reform rules out Tory pact as Sunak faces pressure to call election
value.description: Richard Tice, the leader of the Nigel Farage-linked party, claimed the Tories are ‘terrified’ of the threat Reform poses.

video.name: Reform UK rules out electoral pacts with Tories

value.name: Ed Davey launches “Tory Removal Service” poster as he calls for May 2024 election
value.description: Liberal Democrat Leader Ed Davey has unveiled a new ‘Tory Removal Service’ campaign poster, as he announces a new plan to force a May 2024 election and stop Rishi Sunak clinging on to power.

value.name: Live facial recognition cameras to be trialled in Harrogate and Scarborough pledges mayoral candidate
value.description: Cutting-edge live facial recognition cameras could be deployed in North Yorkshire as early as this year under Tory mayoral candidate Keane Duncan’s “tough-on-crime” agenda.

video.name: Richard Tice says Reform UK will stand in every seat in England, Scotland and Wales

value.name: New procedure for type 2 diabetics being assessed by NHS spending watchdog
value.description: The safety of a procedure for type 2 diabetes patients that uses heat to destroy the lining of part of the small intestine – allowing it to regrow so cells respond better to insulin – is being explored for potential NHS use by the spending watchdog.

value.name: Fishermen net benefits of leaving Common Fisheries Policy
value.description: Fishermen continue to net the benefits of being out of the Common Fisheries Policy after seeing yearly sales incomes rise.

value.name: UK general election: Three potential dates when Britain could go to the polls
value.description: Britain is on its third Prime Minister since Boris Johnson oversaw a landslide victory for the Conservatives in December 2019. In just four years the party has been hit by a number of scandals and now languishes around 20 points behind Labour in opinion polls.

value.name: Anti-Northern Ireland Protocol campaigner Ben Habib to fight Wellingborough by-election for Reform UK
value.description: NI Protocol campaigner Ben Habib will contest a Westminster byelection as a Reform UK candidate for Wellingborough.

value.name: Oxford professor warns against oversharing with AI chatbots
value.description: A professor of computer science at Oxford University has urged individuals using chatbot technology to avoid oversharing personal information.

value.name: Nigel Farage still 'assessing' what role he will play in general election, says Reform UK leader Richard Tice
value.description: Richard Tice says he has been in discussions with Mr Farage about a potential comeback, calling the former Reform UK leader a "master of political timing".

value.name: PSNI Investigate Serious Assault In Strabane
value.description: 03 January 2024 Road Users Urged To Stay Safe On NI's Roads In 2024 Road users have been urged to safeguard their safety and others using NI's roads in 2024. The release of provisional figures today by the PSNI show that 69 people died in road tragedies during 2023.

value.name: Nigel Farage ‘assessing’ his political comeback to party, says Reform UK leader
value.description: Founder of Reform UK, Nigel Farage, failed to turn up to his party’s election campaign launch today, as the current leader Richard Tice announced Farage was ‘assessing’ his return to the far-right political party.

value.name: Are Covid Lockdowns Behind the Rise in Extreme Poverty in the Global South?
value.description: In the context of a huge increase in global poverty since 2020 which has driven political convulsions most especially in low-income countries, a closer look at pandemic policies is vital to safeguard against future missteps.

value.name: Reforms Needed To Prevent Future Political Collapse
value.description: 03 January 2024 New Parents Can Now Apply For Child Benefit Online HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) has announced that new parents can now claim Child Benefit online for the first time since it was launched 47 years ago, helping millions of families with the cost of raising their children.

value.name: Hate crime assault has caused ‘ongoing trauma’, says drag star The Vivienne
value.description: Drag star The Vivienne said a homophobic assault while he waited for food in a McDonald’s has caused “stress, anguish and ongoing trauma”. Last month, magistrates ruled the one-punch attack by scaffolder Alan Whitfield, 51, on James Lee Williams, 31, who performs as the drag queen, was a hate crime.
